gsw_content_information.article:
To view Cases from AWS Support
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases

To manually sync a Support Case

  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases
  4. Choose an Incident to open the record
  5. Click Sync From AWS

To create a general Support Case

  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases
  4. Click New from list header
  5. Fill all mandatory fields on the form.

    • Subject- Brief summary of the question or issue
    • Description – Detailed account of the question or issue
    • AWS Account – AWS account against which the support case is initiated
    • AWS Service – AWS Service related to the support case
    • AWS Category – Category of the case under the related service
    • Caller – ServiceNow field that indicates who created the support ticket.
  1. Click Submit
  2. Choose the Incident that was created, from the list
  3. AWS Case Id and AWS Case Status will be displayed
For AWS Managed Services Accelerate customer to create AMS Accelerate Service Request
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases
  4. Click New from list header
  5. Fill all mandatory fields on the form.

    • Subject- Brief summary of the question or issue
    • Description – Detailed account of the question or issue
    • AWS Account – The account against which the support case is initiated. Please ensure that this account has been onboarded to AMS Accelerate
    • AWS Service – Select AWS Service as AMS Operations – Service Request
    • AWS Category – Select suitable category from AWS Category
    • Caller – ServiceNow field that indicates who created the support ticket.
  1. Click Submit
  2. Choose the Incident that was created, from the list
  3. AWS Case Id and AWS Case Status will be displayed
For AWS Managed Services Accelerate customer to create AMS Accelerate Report Incident
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases
  4. Click New from list header
  5. Fill all mandatory fields on the form.

    • Subject- Brief summary of the question or issue
    • Description – Detailed account of the question or issue
    • AWS Account – The account against which the support case is initiated. Please ensure that this account has been onboarded to AMS Accelerate
    • AWS Service – Select AWS Service as AMS Operations - Report Incident
    • AWS Category – Select suitable category from AWS Category
    • Caller – ServiceNow field that indicates who created the support ticket.
  1. Click Submit
  2. Choose the Incident that was created, from the list
  3. AWS Case Id and AWS Case Status will be displayed
To add a correspondence to an existing Support Case
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases
  4. Choose an Incident to open the record
  5. In the Incident form, scroll to the middle of the page to view Notes tab. Click to open
  6. Add correspondence on the Additional Comments (Customer visible) field.
  7. Click Post
To add an attachment to an existing Support Case
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases
  4. Choose an Incident to open the record
  5. On the Incident form header, click on  to add attachment

                 Note:

                     AWS Support Case attachment has a size limit of 5MB

  1. Choose file from your disk to add the attachment
To resolve a Support Case
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Incidents under AWS Support, to show a list of all synched Support Cases
  4. Choose an Incident to open the record
  5. In the Incident form, scroll to the middle of the page to view Resolution Information tab. Click to open
  6. Fill Resolution Code and Resolution Notes
  7. On the Incident form header, click on the Resolve button
gsw_content_information.title: AWS Support integration features
